data.title: Cubemap clear side and mixing RGB/RGBA problems
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 14.04, Win7 64b, Godot_v2.1_rc1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you set side of cubemap you can't clear it in editor. It gives:
`ERROR: CubeMap::set_side: Condition p_image_empty() is true...`

When you try to create cubemap with RGB and RGBA images it fails with:
`ERROR: RasterizerGLES@::texture_set_data: Condition texture->format != p_image.get_format...`

Clearing sides should be possible.
As for mixing different texture formats, if it's not possible it should at least give some meaningful error.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open example project.
Create new CubeMap.
Add icon.png (saved in RGBA mode) as left side.
Try to add icon_rgb.png (RGB mode) as right side.
It will give you an error.
Now try to clear left side with dropdown menu.
It gives another error.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[cubemap_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/387980/cubemap_bug.zip)

data.title: Offset when determining the size and alignment of bitmap fonts (valign == center)
data.body:
**Godot 2.1**

I started using Godot 2.1 and quickly noticed that the interface of the project looks a bit wrong. Upon closer inspection, it turned out it was fonts:
![0000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11189223/17203725/bba4fd3e-54a9-11e6-9284-98f1596a1872.png)

data.title: ***Error precompiling shader: Expected ')' in expression
data.body:
Somewhere in between 2f8910185ea42a4b401a98b04f869562c87ffed6 and c0e3c1fe7a869b36063b89271977ea0bdeda34a9 my shader breaks. :(

I use a textureshader found in the second post here: http://godotdevelopers.org/index.php?topic=15504.0

At 2f8910185ea42a4b401a98b04f869562c87ffed6 everything was still working, but today I pulled the latest changes, something broke and I get the following error

> ***Error precompiling shader: Expected ')' in expression
> error 12:0

I think this classifies as a regression and is imo a blocker for 2.1.

data.title: Fix Windows resource script
data.body: Also remove the version status from the file description as discussed in #5938.

data.title: ScrollContainer expand children bug fix
data.body:
In current implementation EXPAND flag is ignored when scrolls are enabled, even if they are invisible.
In fixed implementation EXPAND is taken into account when scrolls are invisible which simply means ScrollContainer is bigger than it's content so there is a place to expand.
Difference in implementations on screenshots.
![scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19764492/17187284/e4291c02-5438-11e6-9888-44be1cafc9e4.png)
Fixed implementation:
![scroll_fixed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19764492/17187283/e428d922-5438-11e6-8366-a2bde180cedc.png)

data.title: Project Settings: Use containers for the Input Map tab content
data.body:
Fixes #5932

Before:

![Before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/17181435/6bcbad46-5420-11e6-8818-1cdb09735100.png)

After:

![After](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/17181436/6bcedc96-5420-11e6-9059-1b6106186f1c.png)

---

Notice the following difference that could be changed easily if desired:
- No weird margin at the bottom.
- The small margin between the action name field and the _"Add"_ button is gone (could be added easily with a MarginContainer).
- The _"Add"_ button is a bit smaller.

Before:

After:

data.title: Fix reading of empty StringArray-s in .tscn
data.body: Closes #5912

data.title: Replace all produce crash
data.body:
S.O: Arch Linux 64 bits
Godot Version: v2.1_beta_20160712_x11.64 and Godot_v2.1_rc1_x11

Issue Description: Godot crashes when using "Replace All" for a character that has only one instance in the script.
Steps to reproduce:
  1 - Select a character you want to replace. I tested with '+' and '-'. Make sure your character is only once in the script. In my case, the only '+' instance I have is in this line:  aux.set_translation(get_translation()+Vector3(aux.direccion.x,1,aux.direccion.z))
  2 - In the Replace bar (Ctrl + r), write your desired character and the string you want to replace it. In my case, that would be '+' and ' + '.
  3 - Press "Replace All" (Just "Replace" won't produce a crash)

Note: This bug is nor present in Godot_v2.0.3_stable_x11.64

data.title: Cubemap TSCN/TRES
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Debian Testing, mesa 12.0.1, godot 2.1.rc1.custom_build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Cubemaps are broken if saved as a sub-resource in a TSCN scene or as TRES resources. Looking at the very heavy generated file, it seems Godot saves the textures inside the file in text format, instead of simply referencing them! When playing the scene there is no sky. If you save the same scene as SCN or the resource as CBM there is no problem.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Add a world environment to a TSCN scene, new environment, set mode to cubemap, new cubemap, edit the cubemap adding the 6 required textures such as http://opengameart.org/content/sky-box-sunny-day/, save the scene, the saved .tscn file weights a lot of MBs! Run the scene and there is no sky...

data.title: Save/Load cubemap .tres format problem
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win7 64b, Godot_v2.1_rc1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Can't load cubemap saved in .tres format.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create new project and then create new cubemap.
Set all sides to some file, it can be default Godot icon.
Save cubemap in suggested .tres format.
Close editor then open it once again.
Open previously saved cubemap and look at the files list: only left file is non empty,
probably something is messed up on cubemap export.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[cubemap_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/386146/cubemap_bug.zip)

data.title: negative scale changed into rotation after a spatial node is translated using the 3d viewport gizmo
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

2.1rc1 official win64
2.1beta official win64
2.0.4.1 stable official win64
2.0.2stable official win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When you set a negative scale for a Spatial node and move it using the 3d viewport gizmo, the inspector set the scale positive and change the Rotation to -180 on some axis.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Create a new scene with a TestCube.

Set its scale to (-2, 1, 1) using the Inspector.

Translate it to (3, 0, 0) using the 3d viewport gizmo.

Look at the Inspector.
- Scale became ( 2, 1, 1 )
- Rotation became ( -0, 0, -180 )

On the other hand, if you set the Translation using the Inspector, there is no such behavior.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: move() turns KinematicBody2D's scale from negative to positive
data.body:
on v2.1_beta_20160721_win64

If you use the move() function on a KinematicBody2D, and it's scale is set to negative, it's scale will become positive after moving.

```
extends KinematicBody2D

func _ready():
    set_scale(Vector2(-2,-2))
    print("before move: ",get_scale())
    move(Vector2(3,3))
    print("after move: ",get_scale())
```

This code should print:
before move: -2,-2
after move: 2,2

data.title: Adding a uniform in CanvasItemShader breaks rendering
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1 rc1, Windows 10 64 bits

In order to fix my problem with [Polygon2D's transparency](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5151), I tried to write a shader that outputs alpha according to transparency. But I found again that adding any uniform in a CanvasItemShader produces the same bug as in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/5877 (which was on 3D materials).

Note: surprisingly, it doesn't seems to affect Sprites.

Repro:
[CanvasShaderUniform.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/385046/CanvasShaderUniform.zip)
Open the material on the Polygon2D, edit the shader. Uncomment the uniform.

I didn't managed to find a workaround to have a transparent Polygon2D :(

data.title: Can't drag and drop nodes where i want into Scene tree editor.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1rc1 official, win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Look at the two screenshot below.
It is not possible to drag and drog the "NODE" node at these places :
- between A and B ( NODE will end up into A after Y or before X depending wether A is expanded or not )
- after B ( NODE will end up into B after or before Z depending wether B is expanded or not)

indeed, here, the workaround is to drap and drog A before NODE, or to drop NODE over Root.

But it is strange and unexpected behavior, more even since the red line takes two different length when you drag NODE between Y and B on the first screenshot. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
![dragndrop_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/17151984/21debf16-5376-11e6-95d2-50cadf76b36e.png)
![dragndrop_01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/17151985/23fb1092-5376-11e6-8292-61a5111a17ee.png)

PS: I hate warnings.

data.title: Prettier print for array of Vector
data.body:
``` gdscript
var arr = [Vector2(1,2), Vector2(3,4)]
print(arr)
```

This prints `[1,2, 3,4]`
It would be great if it prints `[(1,2), (3,4)]`

data.title: Add gamepad mapping for the free steam controller userspace driver.
Video trailer to showcase Godot features (version-agnostic)
data.body:
We're now dangerously nearing the 2.1 release (it's more or less release ready now, but we should take the time to prepare some proper PR material before announcing it IMO), so here comes the now obligatory issue about making a cool video trailer for Godot 2.1.

Having such a video would be great for our blog post + maybe landing page + Steam store and, last but not least, for the official press release we'll send all over the world for the press to make some noise about us.

If we don't manage to make a new video in time for the release, we can of course reuse the games showcase done in #3877; what I have in mind here though is something that would show the editor a bit more, and maybe try to highlight the killer features of Godot as a game engine. If we do have a new video for 2.1, I still plan to use the games showcase for the PR anyway, two videos are better than one ;)

I'll start writing some ideas about the contents in the next comment, please add yours :)
